title: pandora-r4880
description:
pan.do/ra a free, open source media archive

To use this disk image in VirtualBox:
- create a new VM
- selet Ubuntu(64 bit) as OS
- minimum of 512Mb RAM
- attach pandora.vdi as primary disk
- go to Settings - Network - Adapter 1: configure as bridged adapter

Once its booted up you can access it via
 <a href=" http://pandora.local/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://pandora.local/</a>
or look in the VirtualBox window for the IP.

The first user that signs up is an admin.

There is also ssh access to the virtual machine,
username and password are "pandora".

more information at https://pan.do/ra
